intro: Thapsia insularis, commonly known as the Canary Island thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Thapsia insularis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native range.
